feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Working Days Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The system shows a greyed-out formula in leave policy that is intentionally replaced by the payroll-side configuration. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. The correct calculation should include 366 days for leap years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations. The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms to ensure exact financial calculations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation shows slight differences from manual calculations, with complexity arising from service duration splits and tiered gratuity rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex service duration segmentation and prorated calculations for partial years
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential complexity in handling precise gratuity calculations for employees with mixed service periods

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (specifically February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation suggested 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Days Worked Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates days worked with a potential extra day (622 vs 623 days), causing slight variations in gratuity calculation. The platform uses a fixed daily wage divisor of 30 days, which differs from client's preferred calculation method of (Basic × 12 / 365).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation and inflexible daily wage computation method
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in gratuity calculation methodology

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on a fixed policy configuration that may not align with user expectations about calendar days. User believed daily wage should be divided by 31 days, but system was dividing by 30 days, resulting in a slight salary calculation difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The leave salary policy uses a 30-day divisor while salary proration uses 30.42 days, leading to different prorated amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently and may use different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salary when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount. The system only correctly prorates salaries when the departure date is in the past.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic error in daily wage calculator prevents accurate salary proration for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Modification
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when calculating unpaid leave deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate in remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave calculations. This can result in deductions calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary, contrary to policy configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not match the leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated using the formula: 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for employees working more or fewer than 26 days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be applied.
limitations.impact: Users cannot use leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions; payroll settings determine the actual calculation

limitations.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations may be incorrect if salary configuration is updated after leave request creation
limitations.impact: Potential payroll calculation errors and manual intervention required

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.
limitations.impact: Potentially incorrect financial settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Inflexible Monthly Leave Accrual
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include partial month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including uncertainty about whether departure date counts as a working day
limitations.impact: Potential minor variations in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows a fixed policy configuration that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method to account for unique monthly variations

limitations.title: Monthly Fluctuations in Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. This means the daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
limitations.impact: Accrual amounts will vary month-to-month due to different working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot automatically align without manual intervention.
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between leave salary and salary proration

limitations.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ from traditional calendar day expectations

limitations.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are deleted or modified
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar month days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may slightly exceed expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Monthly Day Count for Unpaid Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations use calendar days, which can vary by month (e.g., 29 days in February during leap years).
limitations.impact: Accurate daily rate calculations require precise month-specific day counting

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Dynamic Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System recalculates daily rates based on payroll processing month instead of storing the original leave occurrence month rate
limitations.impact: Creates confusion for users tracking leave deductions across different payroll cycles

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically prorate salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks built-in automation for working days-based salary calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking, managed separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in daily wage formula between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings are designed to take precedence for unpaid leave calculations, overriding leave policy formulas
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings first; understand that this configuration will override leave policy formulas

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap year calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and adjust calculation to include 366 days for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service calculations show slightly lower amounts than expected
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculations manually and cross-check with development team's fix

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance not automatically included for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy restricts leave day inclusion for incomplete months
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust EOS balance or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Leave salary is calculated based on daily rate configuration in the leave policy, with a predefined divisor that may not match user expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the system's calculation logic before submitting leave requests

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in leave salary accrual totals across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method, which varies monthly
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use 'custom days' setting for leave encashments to maintain consistent calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and system-calculated leave salary proration
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisors used for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align daily wage configurations or verify specific calculation requirements with system configuration

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week policy and confirm if all days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for offboarded employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic fails to handle departure dates in future relative to payroll processing
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust salary calculations to prorate based on exact departure date

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after leave request modifications
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of synchronization between leave management and payroll deduction systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually review and remove orphaned deductions, contact system administrator for backend cleanup

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Timing mismatch between public holiday addition and payroll calculation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually add a deduction to correct the salary calculation, though not recommended by customers

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Deduction amount differs from expected monthly salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculated as 4300/30.42 = 141.35, then multiplied by days in leave period
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify unpaid leave policy settings and understand the 30.42 days divisor method

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Remarks field shows incorrect days, but actual deduction calculation remains accurate
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount by calculating daily rate using correct calendar days for the month

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected salary deductions during unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overriding policy-specific calculation methods
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate configuration and understand its precedence over policy settings

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unpaid leave deduction calculation appears inconsistent
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily rate calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, with working days excluding public holidays
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: System deployed a fix to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount instead of recalculating

glossary_terms.meaning_from_evidence: Standard monthly calculation of 26 working days, derived from annual working days (365) minus weekly offs (52), resulting in 313 working days per year, divided by 12 months

Calculation method for determining per-day salary, typically involving dividing total salary components by number of days. Can include basic salary only or basic salary plus allowances depending on configuration.
Total monthly salary divided by 30.41 to determine daily wage rate for leave deduction calculations
Calculation of employee benefit based on total service days, typically 21 days per year for service between 1-5 years, prorated based on daily wage
Proportional salary calculation for partial month, typically computed as (basic salary + allowances) / 30 multiplied by days worked
End of Service benefit calculated based on daily wage, service duration, and tiered rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years)
Total number of days worked, calculated by dividing total days by 365, with potential complexities around leap years and departure date counting
Calculated method for determining per-day compensation, typically used in gratuity and end-of-service benefit calculations
The number of days used to divide monthly salary to calculate daily wage, which in this system appears to be configured as a fixed value (typically 30) in leave policy settings
Cumulative calculation of vacation leave monetary value, which can vary based on monthly working days configuration
Method of calculating daily rate by dividing total monthly salary (basic + allowances) by a specific number of days (30 or 30.42)
Days configured as working in the employee's work week, which may include all 7 days with no weekend differentiation
Salary calculation method that adjusts full monthly salary proportionally based on actual days worked, typically calculated as (Monthly Salary / Total Days in Month) × Days Worked
A payroll adjustment representing time off without pay, which should be automatically calculated and removed when leave requests are modified or deleted
Calculated as basic salary plus allowance, divided by the number of working days (excluding weekends and public holidays)
A custom divisor used to calculate daily wage by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 instead of using calendar days
Calculation of salary reduction based on number of unpaid days, divided by total calendar days in the month
A system-wide configuration that determines how daily rates are calculated for unpaid leave, which can override individual policy settings
Calculated as (Basic Salary + Allowances) / Working Days, where working days exclude public holidays

claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect daily rate in remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy settings for unpaid leave calculations. This can result in deductions calculated using gross salary instead of basic salary, contrary to policy configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated using the formula: 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations may be incorrect if salary configuration is updated after leave request creation

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently produce results that are 0.1 or 0.2 less than expected, affecting all employees' End of Service calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Monthly Leave Accrual
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear methodology for counting service days, including uncertainty about whether departure date counts as a working day

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows a fixed policy configuration that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Fluctuations in Daily Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. This means the daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using separate configurations that cannot automatically align without manual intervention.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Depends on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Date Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically remove or reconcile payroll deductions when leave requests are deleted or modified

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with calendar month days

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Day Count for Unpaid Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations use calendar days, which can vary by month (e.g., 29 days in February during leap years).
